sectionData.title: Technical School Student
sectionData.subtitle: IT Technician Profile
sectionData.description: Pursuing a vocational diploma in Information Technology (EQF Level 4), focused on computer systems, networking, and software fundamentals.
listedHighlights: Studied core IT subjects including computer hardware, networking (Cisco CCNAv7), and programming basics
Gained practical experience through industry placement in IT equipment refurbishment
Self-studied advanced web and software development beyond the school curriculum

sectionData.title: Self-Taugh Programming Background
sectionData.description: Began exploring programming at 13 out of curiosity – initially through simple scripting, game modding, and bots. Over time, this interest evolved into building full-stack applications and learning professional development workflows.
listedHighlights: Explored automation, bots, game modding, and scripting early on
Learned to build websites, APIs, and desktop apps just by trying, failing, and repeating
Learned modern frontend and backend stacks: React, TypeScript, Node.js, ASP.NET
Always digging deeper: reading docs, testing things, and picking up new tools as needed
Built and shipped projects on my own – automation tools, mods, utility software
